locations.title: Town Hall Station
locations.clue: In the heart of the city, where trains converge, Underneath the hustle, people emerge. A station of grandeur, with history so grand, Start your journey here, where many do stand.

locations.title: Queen Victoria Building
locations.clue: A queen's name it bears, from an era past, With domes and arches, it’s built to last. Shopping and dining under a clock so tall, Find this palace of commerce and give it your all.

locations.title: St Andrew's Cathedral
locations.clue: Next to Town Hall, with spires that reach high, A place of worship 'neath the Sydney sky. Named for a saint, in gothic style it stands, Seek this sacred space built by many hands.

locations.title: Sydney Tower Eye
locations.clue: Reach for the sky, where eagles fly, A needle in the sky, oh so high. For views of the city, look up and see, The tallest structure, where you want to be.

locations.title: Hyde Park
locations.clue: A green oasis in a city so grand, Statues and fountains on every hand. Named after London’s, a place to unwind, Find this park, where peace you’ll find.

locations.title: St Mary’s Cathedral
locations.clue: Near Hyde Park, with towers twin, A cathedral of grandeur, take a step in. Gothic revival, and windows stained bright, Seek out this church, in the morning light.

locations.title: Sydney Opera House
locations.clue: Sails of white, on the harbour they gleam, An architect's dream, now a symbol supreme. Music and theatre within its halls, Find this house where culture calls.

locations.title: Sydney Harbour Bridge
locations.clue: An arch of steel, spanning the blue, Climb its heights for a breathtaking view. Connects the north with the south side, Seek this bridge, a landmark worldwide.

locations.title: The Rocks
locations.clue: Cobblestone streets with stories to tell, Australia's first settlement, where history dwells. Markets and pubs in buildings of old, Find this quarter, with tales to unfold.

locations.title: Observatory Hill
locations.clue: High above the harbour, where stars are mapped, A hill with a view that can’t be trapped. An old observatory, with vistas wide, Climb this hill, where the city meets the tide.
